articles.title: Struggle of S. Korean unionists
articles.content:
Struggle of S. Korean unionists 
    Pyongyang, May 15 (KCNA) -- More than 3,000 unionists of the National Federation of Metal Industry Workers unions under the South Korean Confederation of Trade Unions held a meeting in Seoul on May 14, calling for a stop to layoff, according to  reports from Seoul.   At the meeting they denounced the "government" for turning aside from massive unemployment and urged it to have negotiations with the trade unions calling for vital rights.   
   Over 8,000 unionists under the federation came to Seoul from 130 workshops across South Korea and held a meeting and demonstration against the murderous "restructuring" on May 13. And then, they pitched 250 large tents on the bank of the Han River and went on an all-night sit-down strike.
Unionists of the hospital attached to Jeonbug National University entered a strike calling for wage increase on May 14.

articles.title: Cohen's ill-boding remarks
articles.content:
Cohen's ill-boding remarks
   Pyongyang, May 15 (KCNA) -- The U.S. Defense Secretary, William Cohen, said at the Senate Appropriation Committee on May 11 that the United States is ready to hurl military force needed for contingencies on the Korean peninsula in the shortest time, according to a news report.   
   He added that he took a "security step" following the move of one U.S. aircraft carrier from the sea near the Korean peninsula to Adriatic Sea after the Kosovo crisis and that it is intended to cope with emergencies on the peninsula and in Asia in a very short time by mobilizing military forces from the U.S. mainland bases. 
   His remarks are getting on nerves of the DPRK, fraught with a very dangerous war hysteria of the U.S. war hawks to bring even to the Korean peninsula  dark clouds of war which the U.S.-led NATO has inflicted  upon Yugoslavia.

Demonstration of S. Korean unionists
articles.content:
Demonstration of S. Korean unionists
     Pyongyang, May 15 (KCNA) -- More than 4,000 unionists of the National Federation of Metal Industry Workers Unions and the National Federation of Public Transport and Service Trade Unions under the South Korean Confederation of Trade Unions staged a demonstration in Jongro Street no. 2 on the afternoon of Friday,  according to a radio report from Seoul.   
    Unionists of the National Federation of Metal Industry Workers Unions held a meeting against the South Korean authorities' unilateral "restructuring" before making a peaceful march up to the Myongdong Cathedral. When riot police blocked their march,  they protested against it and went over to the demonstration.
    The fascist clique sent  34 police companies more than 4,000 strong  to crack down on the demonstration. 
Demonstrators resisted the police, showering stones upon them.

articles.title: Rice transplantation starts in DPRK
articles.content:
Rice transplantation starts in DPRK
   Pyongyang, march 15 (KCNA) -- Rice transplanting has begun in rural areas in the west coasts of Korea.
Farms of Yoltusamcholli and Unjon plains are now operating rice-transplanting machines at full capacity while putting harrowing and major farming work ahead of transplantation. 
   Having worked out concrete daily plans for each field, they are effectively putting all processes into gear,  ensuring the required number of plants  for each Phyong (one Phyong is six feet square) and their stalks.

articles.title: Solidarity demonstration in Denmark
articles.content:
Solidarity demonstration in Denmark
    Pyongyang, May 15 (KCNA) -- The Denmark-DPRK Friendship Association Sponsored a demonstration of solidarity with the Korean People's Cause of National Reunification in Copenhagen on May 1.
   Demonstrators marched on the main street of the city, chanting "the U.S., take hands off Korea" and other slogans and carrying flags of the DPRK and slogan-boards reading:"Support to proposal for founding Democratic Confederal Republic of Koryo", "Korea is one" and "U.S. troops, get out of South Korea".

Juche idea study groups formed
articles.content:
Juche idea study groups formed
   Pyongyang, May 15 (KCNA) -- Groups for Study of the Juche Idea were formed in different countries. 
   The Catania branch of the Italian Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea and the Group for Studying and Applying the Juche Idea in the Czech Republic were formed in April.
More than 30 groups for the study of the Juche idea were inaugurated in Guinea, Madagascar, Zimbabwe, Tanzania, Ethiopia, Bulgaria, Kazakhstan, Malta, Mongolia, Cambodia, Japan and other countries in recent 4 years.   
   Speakers at inaugural meetings said that the Juche idea, a great guiding idea in the era of independence, is an inspiring banner which gives confidence in victory to the people aspiring after an independent, new life.  They expressed their determination to take the lead in studying and disseminating the Juche idea.
